page.title: 02THE MART
page.content: {The Mart }was opened in Scots Gap in 1911.It is owned by 100 shareholders,mainly local farmers. The Mart is open on {Wednesday }for fatstock sales and {Thursday}for special sales.It deals in sheep and cattle. The livestock comes mostly from local farms.Some farmers bring their stock themselves to and from the Mart using tractor and trailer.Others hire local contractors. The number of sheep sold in 1983 was about 75 000,with about 5 000 cattle.Similar numbers were recorded in 1984. The average price of a fat lamb:Â£30,store beast:Â£450,cow and calf Â£150,and fat beast Â£100p per kilo. {July }to {Dec.}is the busy time,and 20 people are then employed,2 auctioneers,4 clerks,and 14 yardsmen.
